header: Today is the Israeli Perl Workshop organized by Sawyer and myself. It is a strange thing as today is still Purim, so some of the participants migh come in costume. We'll see.

There is also a huge list of Perl events for the next few months. I included the four closest, (actually that's 5), but they are all less than 2 month from now. I wonder if we should have a section listing the upcoming Perl Monger events as well, or if I should collect those and put them in some format on the web site. If for nothing else to provide some link-value to these sites.

entries.text: Come join an innovative talented engineering department where you can do some serious Perl programming in a great development environment with clean codebase that is not slapped together. If interested in learning more please contact Marc Spinowitz, Recruiter at MediaMath at mspinowitz@mediamath.com or 646-532-5914
entries.title: MediaMath is hiring Perl Developers: Are you tired of Perl 'scripting'?

entries.text: Do you want to solve real problems of scale involving thousands of servers with various subsystems all deployed multiple times a day? And do you want to work on the largest Perl codebases in the world? Join   Booking.com in Amsterdam. Do awesome things.
entries.title: Now hiring 25 Perl Developers at Booking.com in Amsterdam (relocation + visa included)
Texinfo 5.0 in Perl
entries.text: So part of Texinfo was ported from C to Perl that got some attention on Slashdot. Dave Cross checked the code and gave his opinion on how 'modern' that code is. I find both his comments and the reaction by the author of the code very interesting.

entries.title: A follow up on three-value logic in Perl
entries.text: Do you like to upset your boss? Neiter do I. Apparently Ovid wants avoid that too. So how do you compare undef with a number in a way that it won't mean 0?

entries.title: Try::Lite is especially useful in PSGI handler.
entries.text: Short but to the point. By Tokuhiro Matsuno.

entries.title: CPAN Testers Summary - February 2013 - So
entries.text: The CPAN Testers infrustructure, maintained by Barbie and the Birmingham Perl Mongers, provide a diverse platform to test every module uploaded to CPAN. Sometime within minutes afer the upload. This is the regular monthly report describing the discussions on the mailing list.

entries.title: My play-perl and perl5 core quests
entries.text: Ruslan Zakirov wants to contribute to the Perl 5 porters improving the core language, but he does not have much time and even when he has some it is not in one block. So he is trying to use Play Perl to get his ideas out. Maybe you would have the time to implement them.

entries.title: Improving Perl 5: Grant Report for Month 16
entries.text: This is the regular report by Nicholas Clark.

entries.title: t1: Tell knights from knaves
entries.text: Carl Masak started to go over the solution for the Perl 6 Coding Competition. (and I still have two half-written solution on my hard disk...)

chapters.title: Events
chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on the web site. If your Perl event is not listed there, please let me know.

entries.title: The New York Perl Hackathon
entries.text: On Saturday, March 2, 2013 in, well, New York!
